meanings.sent1: Passengers were emplaning the plane for their vacation.
meanings.sent2: We will be emplaning the flight to Paris shortly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved emplaning into a tiny toy plane.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the birds emplaned on their journey south.
meanings.sent5: The children's excitement was palpable as they emplaned for their first flight.

meanings.definition: The act of getting on an airplane.
meanings.sent1: Emplaning can sometimes be a hectic process at busy airports.
meanings.sent2: The emplaning of passengers was delayed due to a technical issue.
meanings.sent3: The emplaning of the entire soccer team onto the small plane was a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of heights made emplaning a terrifying experience for her.
meanings.sent5: The emplaning of the famous singer caused a stir among the waiting crowd.
